intro: Calystegia obtusa, commonly known as the hairy bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calystegia obtusa is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
